page.title: 17VILLAGE HALL BETTYHILL
page.content: one of the most important buildings in any Highland village is its village hall - a community centre usually built and paid for by the people themselves. To find out about the hall we interviewed the Chairman of the present hall committee. The Chairman told us he had been involved with the running of the hall since it was built in 1955. The committee usually has a membership of 15 to 17. The hall was recently renovated and reopened by the County M.P. Mr Robert Maclennan on 16 December 83. The renovation cost Â£52,000 which was made up of capital grants from HIDB, the SED and the HRC. Rebuilding was done by local contractors and took 6 months to complete. Financially it is a success, but it is a strain on the community finding money to keep it going.
